text: Margaret Jean St. James (September 12, 1937 – January 11, 2021) was an American women's rights activist and sex worker. In 1973 she started the organization COYOTE and St. James Infirmary Clinic. COYOTE is a medical and social service organization helping sex workers in San Francisco. St. James was born in Bellingham, Washington. St. James died on January 11, 2021 under hospice care in San Francisco, aged 83.Margo St. James, the sex workers’ ‘Joan of Arc,’ dies at 83 ==References== Category:1937 births Category:2021 deaths Category:American activists Category:Prostitutes Category:People from Washington (state) Category:People from San Francisco
title: Margo St. James
